title: Pinnacle's new road shoes cost just £50
content:
Will Strickson
23 Nov 2021

Evans Cycles' own-brand launches road, MTB and casual cycling shoes at knock-down prices

Tired of looking for a new pair of cycling shoes and seeing multiple zeros on the price tag? Well, Pinnacle has just released a new range of shoes that are all currently on sale for just £50.

Evans Cycles' own brand, which was launched in 2006, has a large range of bikes and cycling clothing but it didn't sell shoes until now, with road, mountain bike and casual cycling shoes available for both men and women.

Pinnacle Radium shoes

The Radium road shoe, has a classic modern aesthetic with the closure system comprising a dial and a single velcro strap. The outsole is made of nylon, the upper microfibre and the tongue is mesh, bringing the weight to a claimed 306g per shoe (size 8).

  • Buy now from Evans Cycles (£50)

Pinnacle Maple shoes

Meanwhile the Maple mountain bike shoe has been designed for added durability and comfort, with three velcro straps and a soft collar alongside a reinforced toe box, a raised tread and the option for adding studs under the toes. The weight for those is said to be 390g per shoe.

  • Buy now from Evans Cycles (£50)

Pinnacle Cedar shoes

Finally the Cedar, which is made for everyday riding and looks like a pretty normal trainer. That's in part because it is – it's a flat-soled shoe that's made for extra comfort while on the bike with a non-slip heel, a rubber outsole and a mesh tongue. It can obviously be worn off the bike too.

  • Buy now from Evans Cycles (£50)

All the new products have an RRP of £99.99 but are being sold for only £50 at the moment as part of its Black Friday sale.

It comes as part of a wave of new Pinnacle products launched, with the brand releasing their first ever smart trainer the HC Turbo earlier this month.
